Summary of financr Functions

Source: vignettes/Functions_summary.Rmd
Functions_summary.Rmd

This vignette explains the functions offered by 'financr'.

Overview

Inputs. Each function expects a specific type of input, based on its prefix.

Prefix Example Expected_input
search_ search_summary(c('Saab', 'Dow Jones')) Free-text(s)
get_ get_historic(c('SAAB-B.ST', '^DJI' ) ) Financial symbol(s) such as a ticker symbol (e.g., ‘AAPL’) or a 3-letter currency code (e.g., ‘USD’)
last_ last_indices() Do not require any input. All arguments are optional

Outputs. All the 'financr' functions return a standardized data.frame (see the last section ‘Standardized Return Conventions’).

  • Functions with the '_historic' suffix return an historic of financial data,
  • while the others retrieve up-to-date data and latest financial insights.

Details

last_ family.

Functions with the prefix 'last_' retrieve latest data and do not require any input (all arguments are optional).
Example data.frame_returned Source
last_market_summary() Latest summary information for a set of major financial market indices *
last_indices() World indices latest insights and values (USD) ‡
last_crypto() 100 major crypto-currencies latest insights and values (USD) ‡
last_currencies() ISO currency codes for currencies, names and (optionally) latest ‘USD’ values *

  • ‡ : Scraping latest data from Yahoo Finance pages, i.e. https://finance.yahoo.com/markets/world-indices/ or […]/markets/crypto

  • * : Retrieve latest data from Yahoo Finance API (https://query2.finance.yahoo.com)

search_ family.

Functions with the prefix 'search_' retrieve latest data and expect free-text input(s).
Example Returned data.frame Source
search_summary('Saab') Assets names, ticker symbols, latest insights and financial values †
search_assets('Saab') Assets names and symbol(s) associated with the texts searched *
search_asset_quick('Saab') Assets names and symbol(s) associated with the text searched *
  • * : Retrieve latest data from Yahoo Finance API (https://query2.finance.yahoo.com)
  • † : Scraping from https://finance.yahoo.com/lookup/

get_ family.

Functions with the prefix 'get_' retrieve the historical or latest financial values, given financial symbol(s)
Example Input Returned data.frame
get_historic('AAPL')
& get_historic_light('AAPL') 		Asset symbol(s), such as ticker symbols1 Historic of financial data*
get_changes('USD', 'EUR') ISO currency code(s) to convert Latest exchanges rates*
get_changes_historic('USD', 'EUR') ISO currency code(s) Historic of exchanges rates*
get_similar('AAPL') Asset symbol(s) Latest symbols associated with those provided and similarity scores*
  • * : Retrieve latest or historical data from Yahoo Finance API (https://query2.finance.yahoo.com)

Other functions.

Other helper functions
Example Input Data.frame_returned
valid_symbol("AAPL") Text(s) to verify (logical values) Validity of financial symbol(s)*
  • * : Retrieve latest data from Yahoo Finance API (https://query2.finance.yahoo.com)

Standardized Return Conventions

Regarding all the data.frame returned by 'financr' functions:

The column names are:

  • following the ‘snake_case’ conventions, e.g., in lowercase and without spaces;
  • and symbols are replaced (e.g., “%’ is replaced by ‘percent’);

Within the returned data.frame, numeric values are returned as integer or numeric class of values. Thus, the texts answered by Yahoo Finance API are converted into numeric values, e.g., "1.2M" is turned into 1200000 and "85%" into 85.

Examples of similarities and differences with other 'R packages' are in the Vignette ‘Summary of financr Ecosystem’.
